channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Medicare’s New TEAM Hospital Payment Model Will Mean For Seniors
item.description: TEAM may encourage hospitals to improve the quality of the care their patients receive after being discharged. But it also risks further burdening fam...

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2 Premiere: Release Time, Reviews, Season 3 Status And More
item.description: The Pitt season 2 airs tonight, here's its release time, how it's reviewing and some news about season 3 that's just come in.

item.title: AI Agents Fail Without Human Oversight, Here’s Why
item.description: Enterprises everywhere are investing heavily in AI agents with the hope of gaining efficiency, reducing cycle times, and making better decisions.

item.title: State Department suspends all U.S. aid to Somalia, citing ‘zero-tolerance policy for waste, theft, and diversion of life-saving assistance’
item.description: The suspension comes as the Trump administration has ratcheted up criticism of Somali refugees and migrants in the United States.

item.title: Tesla’s vote wasn’t about pay. It was about who really runs the company
item.description: At Tesla’s 2025 Annual Meeting, investors chose to evaluate strategy, incentives, and governance on their own terms.

item.title: The Highest IMDB Audience Scored Show Of 2025 Came Out Of Nowhere
item.description: One of the best shows of 2025 actually became one of the highest scored in IMDB history, and no one saw it coming.

item.title: Google and Character.AI agree to settle lawsuits over teen suicides linked to AI chatbots
item.description: The cases include claims that a chatbot engaged a 14-year-old in sexualized conversations before his death and encouraged another teen to harm his par...

item.title: What’s Actually Next For ‘Stranger Things’ After No Episode 9 Arrived
item.description: Stranger Things episode 9 does not exist, but plenty of other real Stranger Things projects do. Here's what's coming from Netflix next.

item.title: New vehicle sales to decline moderately in 2026 as affordability issues weigh, forecast says
item.description: Cox Automotive forecasts U.S. vehicle sales will decline 2.4% to 15.8 million units in 2026, with fleet sales dropping 6.1% as auto market slows.

item.title: Dallas mayor predicts 'avalanche' of NYC financial firms fleeing new socialist policies under Mamdani
item.description: Dallas Mayor Eric Johnson predicts financial firms will flee New York City for Texas as the Big Apple's new mayor pursues socialist policies.

item.description: The Trump administration's arrest of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro could lead to an increase in defense spending as the White House looks to counte...

item.title: Leading the agentic enterprise: What the next wave of AI demands from CEOs
item.description: With agentic AI on board, companies must rethink their very makeup: how work is designed, how decisions are made, and how value is created.

item.title: Nonprofits are solving 21st century problems—they need 21st century tech
item.description: Every once in a while, history presents us with moments that demand a fundamental shift in approach. This is one of those moments.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
